alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 04 at 11:08AM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1108 AM EDT, gauge reports indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 4 and 8 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... West Palm Beach, Boca Raton, Wellington, Lake Worth, Palm Beach, Greenacres, Royal Palm Beach, Parkland, Palm Springs, Lantana, Atlantis, Haverhill, Cloud Lake, Kings Point, Royal Palm Estates, Lake Belvedere Estates, Gun Club Estates, Golden Lakes, Palm Beach International Airport and Loxahatchee NWR. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report flooding to your local law enforcement agency when you can do so safely.
